intro: Cyclosorus sclerophyllus, commonly known as the rock liverwort, is a non-vascular plant belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its small, dense growth habit and is typically found in rocky or shaded environments. The plant has a thallus that is often divided into lobes, giving it a distinctive appearance. It plays a role in soil stabilization and provides microhabitats for other organisms. Cyclosorus sclerophyllus is often used as an indicator species for moist, acidic substrates.
